      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<span class="line"><!---->When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<!----></span><br><br>One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<span class="line"><!---->One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<!----></span><br><br>NOTE:<span class="line"><!---->NOTE:<!----></span><br>This bug is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This bug is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1283544<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1283544" title="Security: UAF in ProtocolHandlerRegistry::IsHandledProtocol"><!---->crbug.com/1283544<!----></a>, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<span class="line"><!---->, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>base::RepeatingCallback<WebContents*()> wc_getter =<span class="line"><!---->base::RepeatingCallback&lt;WebContents*()&gt; wc_getter =<!----></span><br>    base::BindRepeating([]() -> WebContents* { return nullptr; });<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindRepeating([]() -&gt; WebContents* { return nullptr; });<!----></span><br>std::vector<std::unique_ptr<blink::URLLoaderThrottle>> throttles =<span class="line"><!---->std::vector&lt;std::unique_ptr&lt;blink::URLLoaderThrottle&gt;&gt; throttles =<!----></span><br>    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<!----></span><br>        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<span class="line"><!---->        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<!----></span><br>        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<span class="line"><!---->        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<!----></span><br><br>// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<span class="line"><!---->// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<!----></span><br>auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>    std::make_unique<WorkerScriptLoaderFactory>(<span class="line"><!---->    std::make_unique&lt;WorkerScriptLoaderFactory&gt;(<!----></span><br>        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<span class="line"><!---->        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<!----></span><br>        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<!----></span><br>        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<span class="line"><!---->        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<!----></span><br>    std::move(resource_request),<span class="line"><!---->    std::move(resource_request),<!----></span><br>    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<!----></span><br>                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<span class="line"><!---->                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<!----></span><br>                    initial_request_url));<span class="line"><!---->                    initial_request_url));<!----></span><br>script_fetcher->Start(std::move(throttles));<span class="line"><!---->script_fetcher-&gt;Start(std::move(throttles));<!----></span><br><br>class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<span class="line"><!---->class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<!----></span><br> // skip...<span class="line"><!----> // skip...<!----></span><br> private:<span class="line"><!----> private:<!----></span><br>  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<span class="line"><!---->  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<!----></span><br>    if (!protocol_handler_registry_->IsHandledProtocol(url->scheme()))   // ===> [4]<span class="line"><!---->    if (!protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;IsHandledProtocol(url-&gt;scheme()))   // ===&gt; [4]<!----></span><br>      return;<span class="line"><!---->      return;<!----></span><br>    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_->Translate(*url);<span class="line"><!---->    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;Translate(*url);<!----></span><br>    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<span class="line"><!---->    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<!----></span><br>      *url = translated_url;<span class="line"><!---->      *url = translated_url;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  raw_ptr<custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry> protocol_handler_registry_; // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  raw_ptr&lt;custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry&gt; protocol_handler_registry_; // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855<!----></a><br>[4] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4571;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4571;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4571;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<span class="line"><!---->I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<span class="line"><!---->1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<!----></span><br>node ./server.js<span class="line"><!---->node ./server.js<!----></span><br><br>2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<span class="line"><!---->2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<!----></span><br>out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <span class="line"><!---->out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan.log for details<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan.log for details<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1283546#c1">Comment 1<!----></a>

          
        by

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-error hidden=""><!----><!----></mr-error>
        
          
       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>
    Send email<chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Discard
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Save changes
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        <div class="edit-controls">
          <chops-checkbox id="sendEmail">Send email</chops-checkbox>
          <div>
            <chops-button id="discard" class="de-emphasized">
              Discard
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button id="save" class="emphasized">
              Save changes
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog aria-labelledby="editDialogTitle">
        <h3 id="editDialogTitle" class="medium-heading">
          Edit 
        </h3>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Dec 30, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<span class="line"><!---->When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<!----></span><br><br>One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<span class="line"><!---->One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<!----></span><br><br>NOTE:<span class="line"><!---->NOTE:<!----></span><br>This bug is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This bug is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1283544<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1283544" title="Security: UAF in ProtocolHandlerRegistry::IsHandledProtocol"><!---->crbug.com/1283544<!----></a>, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<span class="line"><!---->, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>base::RepeatingCallback<WebContents*()> wc_getter =<span class="line"><!---->base::RepeatingCallback&lt;WebContents*()&gt; wc_getter =<!----></span><br>    base::BindRepeating([]() -> WebContents* { return nullptr; });<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindRepeating([]() -&gt; WebContents* { return nullptr; });<!----></span><br>std::vector<std::unique_ptr<blink::URLLoaderThrottle>> throttles =<span class="line"><!---->std::vector&lt;std::unique_ptr&lt;blink::URLLoaderThrottle&gt;&gt; throttles =<!----></span><br>    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<!----></span><br>        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<span class="line"><!---->        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<!----></span><br>        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<span class="line"><!---->        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<!----></span><br><br>// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<span class="line"><!---->// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<!----></span><br>auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>    std::make_unique<WorkerScriptLoaderFactory>(<span class="line"><!---->    std::make_unique&lt;WorkerScriptLoaderFactory&gt;(<!----></span><br>        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<span class="line"><!---->        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<!----></span><br>        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<!----></span><br>        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<span class="line"><!---->        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<!----></span><br>    std::move(resource_request),<span class="line"><!---->    std::move(resource_request),<!----></span><br>    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<!----></span><br>                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<span class="line"><!---->                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<!----></span><br>                    initial_request_url));<span class="line"><!---->                    initial_request_url));<!----></span><br>script_fetcher->Start(std::move(throttles));<span class="line"><!---->script_fetcher-&gt;Start(std::move(throttles));<!----></span><br><br>class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<span class="line"><!---->class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<!----></span><br> // skip...<span class="line"><!----> // skip...<!----></span><br> private:<span class="line"><!----> private:<!----></span><br>  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<span class="line"><!---->  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<!----></span><br>    if (!protocol_handler_registry_->IsHandledProtocol(url->scheme()))   // ===> [4]<span class="line"><!---->    if (!protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;IsHandledProtocol(url-&gt;scheme()))   // ===&gt; [4]<!----></span><br>      return;<span class="line"><!---->      return;<!----></span><br>    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_->Translate(*url);<span class="line"><!---->    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;Translate(*url);<!----></span><br>    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<span class="line"><!---->    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<!----></span><br>      *url = translated_url;<span class="line"><!---->      *url = translated_url;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  raw_ptr<custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry> protocol_handler_registry_; // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  raw_ptr&lt;custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry&gt; protocol_handler_registry_; // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" target="_blank" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<span class="line"><!---->I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<span class="line"><!---->1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<!----></span><br>node ./server.js<span class="line"><!---->node ./server.js<!----></span><br><br>2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<span class="line"><!---->2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<!----></span><br>out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <span class="line"><!---->out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan.log for details<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan.log for details<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!           Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-20000

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-20000
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Issue 1283546: Security: UAF in ProtocolHandlerThrottle using PlzDedicatedWorker
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1283546: Security: UAF in ProtocolHandlerThrottle using PlzDedicatedWorker
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      jtrro...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2495879426" title="jtrro...@gmail.com"><!---->jtrro...@gmail.com<!----></a>

        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Dec 30, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<span class="line"><!---->When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<!----></span><br><br>One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<span class="line"><!---->One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<!----></span><br><br>NOTE:<span class="line"><!---->NOTE:<!----></span><br>This bug is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This bug is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1283544<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1283544" title="Security: UAF in ProtocolHandlerRegistry::IsHandledProtocol"><!---->crbug.com/1283544<!----></a>, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<span class="line"><!---->, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>base::RepeatingCallback<WebContents*()> wc_getter =<span class="line"><!---->base::RepeatingCallback&lt;WebContents*()&gt; wc_getter =<!----></span><br>    base::BindRepeating([]() -> WebContents* { return nullptr; });<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindRepeating([]() -&gt; WebContents* { return nullptr; });<!----></span><br>std::vector<std::unique_ptr<blink::URLLoaderThrottle>> throttles =<span class="line"><!---->std::vector&lt;std::unique_ptr&lt;blink::URLLoaderThrottle&gt;&gt; throttles =<!----></span><br>    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<!----></span><br>        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<span class="line"><!---->        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<!----></span><br>        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<span class="line"><!---->        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<!----></span><br><br>// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<span class="line"><!---->// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<!----></span><br>auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>    std::make_unique<WorkerScriptLoaderFactory>(<span class="line"><!---->    std::make_unique&lt;WorkerScriptLoaderFactory&gt;(<!----></span><br>        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<span class="line"><!---->        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<!----></span><br>        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<!----></span><br>        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<span class="line"><!---->        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<!----></span><br>    std::move(resource_request),<span class="line"><!---->    std::move(resource_request),<!----></span><br>    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<!----></span><br>                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<span class="line"><!---->                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<!----></span><br>                    initial_request_url));<span class="line"><!---->                    initial_request_url));<!----></span><br>script_fetcher->Start(std::move(throttles));<span class="line"><!---->script_fetcher-&gt;Start(std::move(throttles));<!----></span><br><br>class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<span class="line"><!---->class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<!----></span><br> // skip...<span class="line"><!----> // skip...<!----></span><br> private:<span class="line"><!----> private:<!----></span><br>  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<span class="line"><!---->  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<!----></span><br>    if (!protocol_handler_registry_->IsHandledProtocol(url->scheme()))   // ===> [4]<span class="line"><!---->    if (!protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;IsHandledProtocol(url-&gt;scheme()))   // ===&gt; [4]<!----></span><br>      return;<span class="line"><!---->      return;<!----></span><br>    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_->Translate(*url);<span class="line"><!---->    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;Translate(*url);<!----></span><br>    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<span class="line"><!---->    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<!----></span><br>      *url = translated_url;<span class="line"><!---->      *url = translated_url;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  raw_ptr<custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry> protocol_handler_registry_; // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  raw_ptr&lt;custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry&gt; protocol_handler_registry_; // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855<!----></a><br>[4] target="_blank" class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<span class="line"><!---->I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<span class="line"><!---->1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<!----></span><br>node ./server.js<span class="line"><!---->node ./server.js<!----></span><br><br>2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<span class="line"><!---->2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<!----></span><br>out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <span class="line"><!---->out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan.log for details<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan.log for details<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

          <h1>

        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Dec 30, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<span class="line"><!---->When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<!----></span><br><br>One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<span class="line"><!---->One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<!----></span><br><br>NOTE:<span class="line"><!---->NOTE:<!----></span><br>This bug is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This bug is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1283544<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1283544" title="Security: UAF in ProtocolHandlerRegistry::IsHandledProtocol"><!---->crbug.com/1283544<!----></a>, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<span class="line"><!---->, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>base::RepeatingCallback<WebContents*()> wc_getter =<span class="line"><!---->base::RepeatingCallback&lt;WebContents*()&gt; wc_getter =<!----></span><br>    base::BindRepeating([]() -> WebContents* { return nullptr; });<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindRepeating([]() -&gt; WebContents* { return nullptr; });<!----></span><br>std::vector<std::unique_ptr<blink::URLLoaderThrottle>> throttles =<span class="line"><!---->std::vector&lt;std::unique_ptr&lt;blink::URLLoaderThrottle&gt;&gt; throttles =<!----></span><br>    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<!----></span><br>        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<span class="line"><!---->        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<!----></span><br>        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<span class="line"><!---->        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<!----></span><br><br>// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<span class="line"><!---->// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<!----></span><br>auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>    std::make_unique<WorkerScriptLoaderFactory>(<span class="line"><!---->    std::make_unique&lt;WorkerScriptLoaderFactory&gt;(<!----></span><br>        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<span class="line"><!---->        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<!----></span><br>        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<!----></span><br>        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<span class="line"><!---->        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<!----></span><br>    std::move(resource_request),<span class="line"><!---->    std::move(resource_request),<!----></span><br>    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<!----></span><br>                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<span class="line"><!---->                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<!----></span><br>                    initial_request_url));<span class="line"><!---->                    initial_request_url));<!----></span><br>script_fetcher->Start(std::move(throttles));<span class="line"><!---->script_fetcher-&gt;Start(std::move(throttles));<!----></span><br><br>class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<span class="line"><!---->class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<!----></span><br> // skip...<span class="line"><!----> // skip...<!----></span><br> private:<span class="line"><!----> private:<!----></span><br>  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<span class="line"><!---->  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<!----></span><br>    if (!protocol_handler_registry_->IsHandledProtocol(url->scheme()))   // ===> [4]<span class="line"><!---->    if (!protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;IsHandledProtocol(url-&gt;scheme()))   // ===&gt; [4]<!----></span><br>      return;<span class="line"><!---->      return;<!----></span><br>    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_->Translate(*url);<span class="line"><!---->    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;Translate(*url);<!----></span><br>    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<span class="line"><!---->    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<!----></span><br>      *url = translated_url;<span class="line"><!---->      *url = translated_url;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  raw_ptr<custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry> protocol_handler_registry_; // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  raw_ptr&lt;custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry&gt; protocol_handler_registry_; // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/chrome_content_browser_client.cc;l=4542;drc=ed107284677e5a88e9356b8a6f10010f8be1d855<!----></a><br>[4] target="_blank" class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<span class="line"><!---->I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<span class="line"><!---->1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<!----></span><br>node ./server.js<span class="line"><!---->node ./server.js<!----></span><br><br>2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<span class="line"><!---->2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<!----></span><br>out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <span class="line"><!---->out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan.log for details<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan.log for details<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thank you for filing this!<span class="line"><!---->Thank you for filing this!<!----></span><br><br>This is just a quick guess. My refactoring CL may have changed the lifetime of WorkerScriptFetcher and it causes this bug.<span class="line"><!---->This is just a quick guess. My refactoring CL may have changed the lifetime of WorkerScriptFetcher and it causes this bug.<!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3110167<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3110167"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3110167<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!           Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-20000

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-20000
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Dec 30, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Dec 30, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Dec 30, 2021)

    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by jtrro...@gmail.com (Dec 30, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<span class="line"><!---->When spawning a dedicated worker, WorkerScriptFetcher::CreateScriptLoader would be invoked and calls to CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles that creates several throttles [1]. These throttles are owned by WorkerScriptFetcher, and the comment says the fetcher is responsible for deleting itself at proper time [2].<!----></span><br><br>One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<span class="line"><!---->One of these throttles is ProtocolHandlerThrottle, and it stores a raw pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry [3]. ProtocolHandlerRegistry is a KeyedService that will be freed if the BrowserContext is gone. When the fetcher receive a redirect response from web server, it will call to ProtocolHandlerThrottle::WillRedirectRequest, and if ProtocolHandlerRegistry has already been freed at this time due to browser Profile destruction, the codes would access the dangling pointer to ProtocolHandlerRegistry at [4], thus causing UAF.<!----></span><br><br>NOTE:<span class="line"><!---->NOTE:<!----></span><br>This bug is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This bug is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1283544<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1283544" title="Security: UAF in ProtocolHandlerRegistry::IsHandledProtocol"><!---->crbug.com/1283544<!----></a>, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<span class="line"><!---->, but I file two seperate issue because the code path to trigger UAF exist in two separate modules. And the possible fix is to use some smart pointers to manage those URLLoaders ownership instead of making them self-owned.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>base::RepeatingCallback<WebContents*()> wc_getter =<span class="line"><!---->base::RepeatingCallback&lt;WebContents*()&gt; wc_getter =<!----></span><br>    base::BindRepeating([]() -> WebContents* { return nullptr; });<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindRepeating([]() -&gt; WebContents* { return nullptr; });<!----></span><br>std::vector<std::unique_ptr<blink::URLLoaderThrottle>> throttles =<span class="line"><!---->std::vector&lt;std::unique_ptr&lt;blink::URLLoaderThrottle&gt;&gt; throttles =<!----></span><br>    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===> [1]<span class="line"><!---->    CreateContentBrowserURLLoaderThrottles(        // ===&gt; [1]<!----></span><br>        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        *resource_request, browser_context, wc_getter,<!----></span><br>        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<span class="line"><!---->        nullptr /* navigation_ui_data */,<!----></span><br>        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<span class="line"><!---->        RenderFrameHost::kNoFrameTreeNodeId);<!----></span><br><br>// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<span class="line"><!---->// This fetcher will delete itself. See the class level comment.<!----></span><br>auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===> [2]<span class="line"><!---->auto* script_fetcher = new WorkerScriptFetcher(    // ===&gt; [2]<!----></span><br>    std::make_unique<WorkerScriptLoaderFactory>(<span class="line"><!---->    std::make_unique&lt;WorkerScriptLoaderFactory&gt;(<!----></span><br>        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<span class="line"><!---->        worker_process_id, worker_token, trusted_isolation_info,<!----></span><br>        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<span class="line"><!---->        service_worker_handle, browser_context_getter,<!----></span><br>        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<span class="line"><!---->        std::move(url_loader_factory), worker_source_id),<!----></span><br>    std::move(resource_request),<span class="line"><!---->    std::move(resource_request),<!----></span><br>    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<span class="line"><!---->    base::BindOnce(DidCreateScriptLoader, std::move(callback),<!----></span><br>                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<span class="line"><!---->                    std::move(subresource_loader_factories),<!----></span><br>                    initial_request_url));<span class="line"><!---->                    initial_request_url));<!----></span><br>script_fetcher->Start(std::move(throttles));<span class="line"><!---->script_fetcher-&gt;Start(std::move(throttles));<!----></span><br><br>class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<span class="line"><!---->class ProtocolHandlerThrottle : public blink::URLLoaderThrottle {<!----></span><br> // skip...<span class="line"><!----> // skip...<!----></span><br> private:<span class="line"><!----> private:<!----></span><br>  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<span class="line"><!---->  void TranslateUrl(GURL* url) {<!----></span><br>    if (!protocol_handler_registry_->IsHandledProtocol(url->scheme()))   // ===> [4]<span class="line"><!---->    if (!protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;IsHandledProtocol(url-&gt;scheme()))   // ===&gt; [4]<!----></span><br>      return;<span class="line"><!---->      return;<!----></span><br>    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_->Translate(*url);<span class="line"><!---->    GURL translated_url = protocol_handler_registry_-&gt;Translate(*url);<!----></span><br>    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<span class="line"><!---->    if (!translated_url.is_empty())<!----></span><br>      *url = translated_url;<span class="line"><!---->      *url = translated_url;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>  raw_ptr<custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry> protocol_handler_registry_; // ===> [3]<span class="line"><!---->  raw_ptr&lt;custom_handlers::ProtocolHandlerRegistry&gt; protocol_handler_registry_; // ===&gt; [3]<!----></span><br>};<span class="line"><!---->};<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=405;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/worker_host/worker_script_fetcher.cc;l=417;drc=7b628df4aeff8da0d9f94f01632d08e0d5a0b7ea<!----></a><br>[3] class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<span class="line"><!---->I tested the poc on version 99.0.4763.1<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<span class="line"><!---->1. Setup a HTTP server using nodejs<!----></span><br>node ./server.js<span class="line"><!---->node ./server.js<!----></span><br><br>2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<span class="line"><!---->2. Run following command, the browser should crash in a few seconds<!----></span><br>out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <span class="line"><!---->out/Asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxx/ --enable-features=PlzDedicatedWorker <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan.log for details<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan.log for details<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and FoundIn labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

having a dangling ptr<span class="line"><!---->DanglingPtr: Prevent ProtocolHandlerThrottle from having a dangling ptr<!----></span><br><br>This CL prevents ProtocolHandlerThrottle from having a dangling ptr to<span class="line"><!---->This CL prevents ProtocolHandlerThrottle from having a dangling ptr to<!----></span><br>ProtocolHandlerRegistry by replacing raw_ptr with base::WeakPtr.<span class="line"><!---->ProtocolHandlerRegistry by replacing raw_ptr with base::WeakPtr.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1283546<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" I939525e99c79a16a221eb696357ddde8e86fc9a0<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I939525e99c79a16a221eb696357ddde8e86fc9a0<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on:
